verses.verse: The Lord said, “I will bring (Num. 21:33; Deut. 30:1-9; Amos 9:1-3) back from Bashan, I will bring them back (Ex. 14:22) from the depths of the sea,
(Ps. 58:10) That your foot may crush them in blood, (1 Kin. 21:19; Jer. 15:3) And the tongues of your dogs may have their portion from your enemies.”
They have seen Your procession, O God, The procession of my God, my King, into the sanctuary.
(1 Chr. 13:8) The singers went before, the players on instruments followed after; Among them were the maidens playing timbrels.
Bless God in the congregations, The Lord, from (Deut. 33:28; Is. 48:1) the fountain of Israel.
(Judg. 5:14; 1 Sam. 9:21) There is little Benjamin, their leader, The princes of Judah and their company, The princes of Zebulun and the princes of Naphtali.
Your God has (Ps. 42:8; Is. 26:12) commanded your strength; Strengthen, O God, what You have done for us.
Because of Your temple at Jerusalem, (1 Kin. 10:10, 25; 2 Chr. 32:23; Ps. 45:12; 72:10; Is. 18:7) Kings will bring presents to You.
Rebuke the beasts of the reeds, (Ps. 22:12) The herd of bulls with the calves of the peoples, Till everyone (2 Sam. 8:2) submits himself with pieces of silver. Scatter the peoples who delight in war.
(Is. 19:19-23) Envoys will come out of Egypt; (Is. 45:14; Zeph. 3:10) Ethiopia will quickly (Ps. 44:20) stretch out her hands to God.
Sing to God, you ((Ps. 67:3, 4)) kingdoms of the earth; Oh, sing praises to the Lord, Selah
To Him (Deut. 33:26; Ps. 18:10) who rides on the heaven of heavens, which were of old! Indeed, He sends out His voice, a (Ps. 46:6; Is. 30:30) mighty voice.
(Ps. 29:1) Ascribe strength to God; His excellence is over Israel, And His strength is in the clouds.
O God, (Ps. 76:12) You are more awesome than Your holy places. The God of Israel is He who gives strength and power to His people. Blessed be God!
(An Urgent Plea for Help in Trouble) To the Chief Musician. Set to “The Lilies.” A Psalm of David. [1] Save me, O God! For (Job 22:11; Jon. 2:5) the waters have come up to my neck.
(Ps. 40:2) I sink in deep mire, Where there is no standing; I have come into deep waters, Where the floods overflow me.
(Ps. 6:6) I am weary with my crying; My throat is dry; (Deut. 28:32; Ps. 119:82, 123; Is. 38:14) My eyes fail while I wait for my God.

Those who (Ps. 35:19; John 15:25) hate me without a cause Are more than the hairs of my head; They are mighty who would destroy me, Being my enemies wrongfully; Though I have stolen nothing, I still must restore it.
O God, You know my foolishness; And my sins are not hidden from You.
Let not those who wait for You, O Lord GOD of hosts, be ashamed because of me; Let not those who seek You be confounded because of me, O God of Israel.
Because for Your sake I have borne reproach; Shame has covered my face.
(Is. 53:3; Mark 3:21; Luke 8:19; John 7:3-5) I have become a stranger to my brothers, And an alien to my mother’s children;
(John 2:17) Because zeal for Your house has eaten me up, (Rom. 15:3) And the reproaches of those who reproach You have fallen on me.
When I wept and chastened my soul with fasting, That became my reproach.
I also made sackcloth my garment; I became a byword to them.
Those who sit in the gate speak against me, And I am the song of the (Job 30:9) drunkards.
But as for me, my prayer is to You, O LORD, in the acceptable time; O God, in the multitude of Your mercy, Hear me in the truth of Your salvation.
Deliver me out of the mire, And let me not sink; Let me be delivered from those who hate me, And out of the deep waters.
Let not the floodwater overflow me, Nor let the deep swallow me up; And let not the pit shut its mouth on me.
Hear me, O LORD, for Your lovingkindness is good; Turn to me according to the multitude of Your tender mercies.
And do not hide Your face from Your servant, For I am in trouble; Hear me speedily.
Draw near to my soul, and redeem it; Deliver me because of my enemies.
You know (Ps. 22:6, 7; Heb. 12:2) my reproach, my shame, and my dishonor; My adversaries are all before You.
Reproach has broken my heart, And I am full of heaviness; (Is. 63:5) I looked for someone to take pity, but there was none; And for (Job 16:2) comforters, but I found none.
They also gave me gall for my food, (Matt. 27:34, 48; Mark 15:23, 36; Luke 23:36; John 19:28-30) And for my thirst they gave me vinegar to drink.
(Rom. 11:9, 10) Let their table become a snare before them, And their well-being a trap.
